strings.toAbout: Interested in knowing more about me and my skills?

about.p1: I qualified as an engineer in the spring of 2018, majoring in Mediatechnology. I've had a passion, even from a young age, for visualisation and front-end technologies. My greatest strengths lie in user interface design and 3d-modeling. That doesn't mean I avoid coding however, and infact I have familiarized myself with different front- and back-end frameworks even outside my studies.
about.p2: I'm interested in combining technology and visualisation into something that is usable for the end user. I'm always learning new things and I try to understand all aspects of technologies so that I might apply my existing experience in all new situations. Challenges keep me motivated.

description: Outdoor sign for wayfinding at Isku Center. The sign was desinged in two sizes: 1500mm x 2000mm and 3220mm x 1890mm, and was set up in fall of 2018.
The sign was commissioned by Lahti University of Applied Sciences Campus Developemt and Isku Oy
The design was based on a preliminary layout of the sign. As the project progressed the design was iterated upon based on client feedback.

I added a 3d-visualization of LUAS M19 campus room D267 to the 3d.lamk-fi -service. The framework of the room was already modeled, and was used a base for further modeling. The models were also UV-unwrapped and textured. A visual furnishing catalog for the room was used as a reference for the modeling, along with Isku furniture reference images.
The project also included in it a redesign for the 3d.lamk.fi -service interface layout and some functionality improvements for fetching the room information dynamically.
projects.tools: Blender, HTML, CSS, Javascript, jQuery, Bootstrap, Sketchfab

description: My thesis project in which the goal was to design a mobile user interface for Salpausselk√§ Geopark application.
The design process was approached using mobile-first principles and the user interface styling implemented Google's Material Design.

The project was a two-day long hackathon team-contest event organized by Kemppi Oy. The goal of the project was to create a REST-API for fetching information onto a UI designed by the team. The responsibilities of the team members were divided according to the strengths of the team members. The different responsibilities were back-end, front-end and user interface design. I was responsible for designing the UI using HTML and the Bootstrap CSS framework.
The team's production won the 2nd place price in the contest and got a special mention for the interface design.

projects.recipient: Lahti Aqua Hackathon for LUAS students
description: A one-day long hackathon team-contest event organized by Lahti Aqua. The goal of the project was to create a user interface design for a mobile application, additionally the team was asked to design the database infrastructure and make a suggestion on what technologies should be used to implement the application.

The contest was completed in a four-man team, with one team member focusing on the back-end, two on the user interface and one working as the Scrum-master. The team ended up suggesting that the application should be implemented using hybrid-technologies, so that it would be possible to build the application for Android, iOS and, if need be, web-platforms.
I participated in the project as a user interface designer. And for the presentation, I created a website with which to demonstrate the functionality of the application using Chrome devtools.
The team's production won the 1st place price in the contest.
The final submission for a 3d-modeling course. A model of a Webster Chicago Wire Recorder.
The goal of the course was to learn the basics of Subdivision hard-surface -modeling.
The final submission for a two-week long Game Modeling -course. The goal of the course was to create a 3d-model and import it into the Unity 3D game engine.
As I had previous experience on the workflow required for the coursework, I took the opportunity to learn about a new texturing tool (Substance Painter) during the course.
The final submission for a two-week long 3d-animation course. The goal of the course was to create a short character animation
In addition to modeling the character, I modeled an environment for the animation, using a low-poly style.
